section.title: Delete your network with cURL
section.para: These sections walk you through deleting your subnet and network by using cURL.

section.title: Delete a subnet (cURL)
section.para: To delete a subnet, specify the subnet ID.

step.para:
Issue the following cURL command, substituting your own values for the ones shown:
$ curl -i https://dfw.networks.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/subnets/23e3059e-4f39-4f7f-8cf2-c326e5de6c37 \ -X 'DELETE' \ -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" \ -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: $account" \ -H "Accept: application/json"

note.para: Include the -i option in the cURL command to show the response header. Omit the | python -m json.tool clause from the command because the API operation does not return a JSON response.

listitem.para: id. The ID of the network that you want to delete. In this example, the network ID is 29f52c7e-6efd-4335-a14a-db77d32a2555.

step.para: Successful deletion returns an 202 Accepted response code:

screen.computeroutput:
HTTP/1.1 204 No Content Date: Thu, 04 Oct 2012 16:23:30 GMT Content-Length: 58 Content-Type: text/html;charset=UTF-8 Server: Jetty(8.0.y.z-SNAPSHOT)
202 Accepted
The request is accepted for processing.

section.title: Delete a network (cURL)
section.para: To delete a network, specify the network ID.

step.para:
Issue the following cURL command, substituting your own values for the ones shown:
$ curl -i https://dfw.networks.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/networks/29f52c7e-6efd-4335-a14a-db77d32a2555 \ -X 'DELETE' \ -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" \ -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: $account" \ -H "Accept: application/json"

note.para: Include the -i option in the cURL command to show the response header. Omit the | python -m json.tool clause from the command because the API operation does not return a JSON response.

listitem.para: id. The ID of the subnet that you want to delete. In this example, the subnet ID is 23e3059e-4f39-4f7f-8cf2-c326e5de6c37.

step.para: Successful deletion returns an 202 Accepted response code:

screen.computeroutput:
HTTP/1.1 204 No Content Date: Thu, 04 Oct 2012 16:23:30 GMT Content-Length: 58 Content-Type: text/html;charset=UTF-8 Server: Jetty(8.0.y.z-SNAPSHOT)
202 Accepted
The request is accepted for processing.

para.link: Use allocation pools to control dynamic IP address allocation
